Grunsky coefficients

Let

f(z)=∑n=0∞anznf\p{z} = \sum_{n=0}^\infty a_nz^nf(z)=n=0∑∞​an​zn

be a holomorphic function in D\DD. Show that if

∑n=2∞n∣an∣≤∣a1∣\sum_{n=2}^\infty n\abs{a_n} \leq \abs{a_1}n=2∑∞​n∣an​∣≤∣a1​∣

with a1≠0a_1 \neq 0a1​=0 then fff is injective.
Solution.

Consider the function

g(z,w)=g(z)−g(w)z−wg\p{z, w} = \frac{g\p{z} - g\p{w}}{z - w}g(z,w)=z−wg(z)−g(w)​

for z,w∈Dz, w \in \Dz,w∈D. Since fff is analytic, we have the following expansion for ggg:

g(z,w)=1z−w(∑n=0∞anzn−∑n=0∞anwn)=a1+∑n=2∞(an∑k=0n−1zn−1−kwk).\begin{aligned} g\p{z, w} &= \frac{1}{z - w} \p{\sum_{n=0}^\infty a_nz^n - \sum_{n=0}^\infty a_nw^n} \\ &= a_1 + \sum_{n=2}^\infty \p{a_n \sum_{k=0}^{n-1} z^{n-1-k}w^k}. \end{aligned}g(z,w)​=z−w1​(n=0∑∞​an​zn−n=0∑∞​an​wn)=a1​+n=2∑∞​(an​k=0∑n−1​zn−1−kwk).​

Given z≠wz \neq wz=w in D\DD, let r=max⁡ {∣z∣,∣w∣}r = \max\,\set{\abs{z}, \abs{w}}r=max{∣z∣,∣w∣} so that ∣z∣,∣w∣≤r<1\abs{z}, \abs{w} \leq r < 1∣z∣,∣w∣≤r<1. Applying this along with the triangle inequality yields

∣g(z,w)∣≥∣a1∣−r∑n=2∞n∣an∣≥∣a1∣(1−r)>0,\begin{aligned} \abs{g\p{z, w}} \geq \abs{a_1} - r\sum_{n=2}^\infty n\abs{a_n} \geq \abs{a_1}\p{1 - r} > 0, \end{aligned}∣g(z,w)∣≥∣a1​∣−rn=2∑∞​n∣an​∣≥∣a1​∣(1−r)>0,​

since a1≠0a_1 \neq 0a1​=0. Thus, g(z,w)≠0g\p{z, w} \neq 0g(z,w)=0, and so f(z)≠f(w)f\p{z} \neq f\p{w}f(z)=f(w) for any distinct z,w∈Dz, w \in \Dz,w∈D.
